terms.definition: Validation and Test Engineer - professionals responsible for ensuring medical devices meet safety, efficacy, and regulatory compliance standards through rigorous testing and documentation
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and ensure everyone works with the latest version
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, essential for regulatory compliance and accountability
Food and Drug Administration Quality System Regulation - regulatory framework that governs the methods, facilities, and controls used in manufacturing medical devices
terms.expanded: Food and Drug Administration Quality System Regulation

terms.definition: International standard that specifies requirements for a quality management system specifically designed for organizations involved in medical device development and manufacturing
Detailed documented procedures that outline the purpose, methods, acceptance criteria, and steps for testing medical devices to ensure they meet specifications
A document that maps and traces requirements, test cases, and validation activities to ensure complete coverage and regulatory compliance
Medical Device Regulation - European Union regulation that governs the safety and performance requirements for medical devices sold in the EU market
Software and services that run on remote servers accessed via the internet, allowing users to store, manage, and collaborate on documents from anywhere
A unified system where all documents are stored in a single, accessible location rather than scattered across multiple systems or devices
Groups of people with different functional expertise working together toward a common goal, such as R&D, quality assurance, and engineering teams
Ongoing monitoring and evaluation of medical devices after they have been released to market to ensure continued safety and effectiveness
The ability of software systems to connect and work together, allowing data and processes to flow seamlessly between different platforms and tools
Pre-designed document formats that include required sections, fields, and structures to help ensure adherence to regulatory standards and industry requirements
Software as a Service - a cloud computing model where software applications are delivered over the internet on a subscription basis rather than installed locally
